name: REPEAT_PURCHASE_SWITCH_NAME

routers.commit_message_added:
Added switch for repeat purchase check

This check to avoid allowing learners purchasing the same item multiple times is a nuisance in development and test environments. If refund deadlines pass, there is no simple way for developers to get into a state where they can view the checkout page. Disabling this check allows for the addition of items regardless of whether they have been previously purchased.
routers.commit_message_deleted:
Fixed switch to disable repeat order check

The switch has been moved to the UserAlreadyPlacedOrder class to avoid breaking the ability to add items to baskets.

name: PROGRAM_APPLICATOR_USE_FLAG

routers.commit_message_added:
Add custom program applicator

Custom program applicator aims to reduce queries for program offers by
matching offers with the bundle identifier.

EG-3

-Updated ProgramApplicator to CustomApplicator.
-Override Applicator get_site_offers to only get offers
valid for baket without bundle.
-Override BasketMiddleware apply_offers_to_basket to
use CustomApplicator.
-Used CustomApplicator in basketmiddleware and utils
-Updated constants
-Updated tests

category_comment: Author in PR1952 and PR1925 indicates the toggle is used to activate/deactivate a refactoring of the 'enterprise discounting behavior' in a staging environment. Also, a detailed test plan is provided. Even after the first removal, they re-introduced them because the author thought the refactoring was the cause of an issue (PR2273), clearly, to use it as as a kill switch.

name: jwt_decode_handler.log_exception.edx-drf-extensions

routers.commit_message_added:
Enhance jwt_decode_handler to handle transition.

As part of ARCH-261, the ecommerce service and ecom-workers will be
transitioning to use the LMS as the sole issuer of JWT tokens. This
update temporarily make the jwt_decode_handler work with several
steps of the final rollout. Ultimately, once the jwt_decode_handler
is only being used to delegate the the edx-drf-extensions version of
the jwt_decode_handler, this custom one will be retired.  See ARCH-261
for the detailed plan.

ARCH-274

category_comment: Code under the toggle is a debug logging on a failure path.

name: jwt_decode_handler.log_exception.ecommerce-updated-config

routers.commit_message_added:
Enhance jwt_decode_handler to handle transition.

As part of ARCH-261, the ecommerce service and ecom-workers will be
transitioning to use the LMS as the sole issuer of JWT tokens. This
update temporarily make the jwt_decode_handler work with several
steps of the final rollout. Ultimately, once the jwt_decode_handler
is only being used to delegate the the edx-drf-extensions version of
the jwt_decode_handler, this custom one will be retired.  See ARCH-261
for the detailed plan.

ARCH-274

category_comment: Code under the toggle is a debug logging on a failure path.

name: jwt_decode_handler.log_exception.ecommerce-original

routers.commit_message_added:
Enhance jwt_decode_handler to handle transition.

As part of ARCH-261, the ecommerce service and ecom-workers will be
transitioning to use the LMS as the sole issuer of JWT tokens. This
update temporarily make the jwt_decode_handler work with several
steps of the final rollout. Ultimately, once the jwt_decode_handler
is only being used to delegate the the edx-drf-extensions version of
the jwt_decode_handler, this custom one will be retired.  See ARCH-261
for the detailed plan.

ARCH-274
routers.commit_message_deleted:
Remove jwt_decode_handler for old config format.

The original jwt_decode_handler code for ecommerce had JWT_ISSUERS
configured as a list of issuer names, and the secret keys were in a
separate config JWT_SECRET_KEYS. The newer config that consolidates
these into an array of issuer objects under JWT_ISSUERS is now complete,
so we are removing all the code that relied on the original
configuration that is no longer in use.

NOTE: Top-level JWT_SECRET_KEY config in JWT_AUTH could probably also
be cleaned up, but leaving that to a separate effort.

ARCH-279

category_comment: Code under the toggle is a debug logging on a failure path.

name: ENABLE_MICROFRONTEND_FOR_BASKET_PAGE_FLAG_NAME

routers.commit_message_added: Add enable_microfrontend_for_basket_page feature toggle
routers.commit_message_deleted:
ARCH-1101: add query param to coupon redeem redirect (#2554)

add query param to coupon redeem redirect

The CouponRedeemView redirects to the Payment MFE at times when the
Payment MFE will in turn be told to redirect elsewhere (e.g. the free
basket page).  To avoid flashing the payment form, the Payment MFE will
be sent a special query param that tells it not to display the payment
form until it knows whether or not it is needed (i.e. until it gets
a response from the server).

ARCH-1101
